meanings.definition: Not able to withstand cold temperatures or harsh conditions.
meanings.sent1: The delicate flowers were nonhardy and withered quickly in the frost.
meanings.sent2: The nonhardy plant wilted as soon as the temperature dropped.
meanings.sent3: The nonhardy seedlings shivered in the chilly breeze, wishing for a warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her nonhardy constitution crumbled under the pressure of the challenging hike.
meanings.sent5: The nonhardy glass shattered at the lightest touch, showing its fragility.

meanings.sent1: The nonhardy fabric tore easily with a gentle tug.
meanings.sent2: His nonhardy spirit faltered in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent3: The nonhardy toy broke after just a few minutes of rough play.
meanings.sent4: The nonhardy bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent5: Her nonhardy resolve crumbled at the first sign of trouble.

meanings.definition: Not suitable for planting in cold climates.
meanings.sent1: The nonhardy flowers wilted in the icy soil of the northern garden.
meanings.sent2: The nonhardy crop failed to thrive in the frosty fields.
meanings.sent3: The nonhardy tree refused to grow in the chilly mountain climate.
meanings.sent4: The nonhardy shrubs struggled to survive in the harsh winter conditions.
meanings.sent5: The nonhardy vegetables froze in the nonstop cold, unable to adapt.
